intro: Senecio pirottae, commonly known as the Pirotta's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in a single head, surrounded by bracts. Senecio pirottae is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
